meta.content:
April 17, 2020
Dear Parents and Families,
Teacher driven remote learning started this week. You should have heard from your child’s teacher(s) to talk about lesson plans, learning expectations, and family needs. We are very pleased with the high number of students engaged in the learning provided this week. Thank you for your support of our schools’

a.span: Dick Mealy Memorial Pool @ Mark Morris

article.class: post-7006 avada_portfolio type-avada_portfolio status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry portfolio_category-topical

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_2_3 fusion-builder-column-0 fusion-two-third fusion-column-first 2_3

div.p: Teacher driven remote learning started this week. You should have heard from your child’s teacher(s) to talk about lesson plans, learning expectations, and family needs. We are very pleased with the high number of students engaged in the learning provided this week. Thank you for your support of our schools’ efforts.

Whether your child is receiving online remote learning, printed learning materials or a combination of both, we acknowledge this is a very different type of instruction than what any of us are used to. There may be some discomfort in the transition, and that’s to be expected. The most important thing is that students stay engaged and keep learning. Please encourage your students to follow the lesson plan(s) and to engage in the learning as best they can. We need your continued help and support to assure the success of this learning model.

We have heard some questions about the online video conference tool called Zoom, which some classes are using for group discussions. The school district has designed all Zoom video lessons to be secure for your student to participate. The use of passwords given only to students, not using any personal student information during the lessons, and locking all uninvited participants out are just some of the security features we’re using. To assure privacy, we are also not recording any Zoom sessions that are conducted.
If you have questions about these topics or others, you can reach out to your teacher, principal or me.
Enjoy this beautiful spring sunshine and stay safe.

Dan Zorn, Superintendent
Longview Public Schools
